channel.title: This is ridiculous
channel.description:
Membership Price Changes - 1st March 2015
mod_ronan
January 23 2015 Membership Price Changes - 1st March 2015 In November, we announced that we would be increasing the price of membership for new members and those who've been unsubscribed for more than 14 days.
Today, we can confirm that this will come into effect on the 1st of March 2015. You can find the new pricing below:
[img]http://cdn.runescape.com/assets/img/external/news/2015/01/currency_table.jpg[/img]
US, UK, EU, AU and CA membership prices The price of Bonds will also increase:
[img]http://cdn.runescape.com/assets/img/external/news/2015/01/bonds_table.jpg[/img]
US, UK, EU, AU and CA Bond prices Don't forget - as long as you're a member and don't lapse out for more than 14 days, you're eligible to keep your current rate of membership. Subscribe now to secure access to all of RuneScape's members' content at current prices.
As always, we're committed to giving you the very best value for your membership. Even at the new full price, RuneScape is highly competitive with other MMOs, and we've got great plans for the rest of 2015.
Thanks again for your ongoing support. Visit our FAQ if you have any further questions.
The RuneScape Team

item.title: This is ridiculous
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

“We are getting competition against RS , let’s raise the price that should do it”

k den.

Read full topic

item.title: This is ridiculous
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Don’t lose your membership, and you’ll be fine. Plus, if you don’t want to spend real money on it, use in-game GP to get bonds. They’ll rise, of course, but not a whole lot. I’m assuming they’ll be around 10m-ish, which is less than 1.5 hours at RoTS, 2-2.5 hours at QBD, and just a few kills at Nex, which really isn’t that much time spent getting 14 days of membership.

Read full topic

item.title: This is ridiculous
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

When I did re-subscribe I was playing about ~10 hours a week since it was painful to play such a shit game, but now I will probably never re-subb at this price. Not worth it at this point, plus with the bonds I’d rather go to a gold site

Read full topic

item.title: This is ridiculous

item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

ok now i seriously have to buy membership
unless someone wants to do it for me

Read full topic

item.title: This is ridiculous
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

-They have added more employees
-They have lost quite severely large sums of income in the past couple of years ( and probably expect with the GE addition in OSRS that at least a minority may even quit )
-As long as you keep your membership you shouldn’t have anything to worry about.

Read full topic

item.title: This is ridiculous
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:3, topic:549359”]It’s essentially doubled over the last few years. $5 was a great price pr month, but runescape doesn’t have the content of a $120 yr game[/quote]that’s why it’s only $90 a year!

Jibes aside, I’ve always looked at these games the same way. How much time do you put into the game? You can argue all you want about how much content there is and how many updates there are per month, but strictly speaking the only thing that matters in my opinion is your time put in and if you consider that to be worth your money. Some people spend 30-60 dollars for games that they spend maybe 10-20 hours beating and then never play again. That means you’re paying lets say 3 dollars per hour of play time. That sounds like a bit much though, so lets just cut that down and assume you get 60 hours out of that title, cutting it to 1 dollar per hour of playtime. Do you play RS more than 10 hours a month? If you do, it’s probably not a big deal that they are increasing the cost.

Read full topic

At this point I might as well be playing World of Warcraft instead of RuneScape

In November, we announced that we would be increasing the price of membership for new members and those who’ve been unsubscribed for more than 14 days.
